attributes.action: Make all motorway service station parking free, and ban charges for overstaying
attributes.additional_details:
RoSPA estimate driver fatigue to be a factor in 20% of road accidents and that these crashes are 50% more likely to result in death or serious injury.
(https://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/drivers/fatigue/policy-statements/)

The Highway Code instructs:

"If you feel at all sleepy, stop in a safe place. Do not stop on the hard shoulder of a motorway."

In France, it is expected that drivers stop and rest when they get tired and, as such, rest stops are generally free of parking charges.
attributes.background:
Motorway service areas are universally understood as places for tired drivers to recuperate, ensuring maximum attentiveness and safety on the roads.
In the UK, service areas frequently charge two-three figure sums to anyone overstaying a couple of hours, making safe resting/sleeping impossible.

rejection.details: Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action, and it is not clear whether you want to make all parking free or to ban charges for overstaying.
